channel.title: Spring Boot Basics on Coding N Concepts
channel.description: Recent content in Spring Boot Basics on Coding N Concepts

item.title: Configure Log4j 2 Logging in Spring Boot
item.description: In this quick tutorial, we’ll configure Log4j 2 logging by replacing it with the default Logback config in the Spring Boot application.

item.title: How to Change Context Path in Spring Boot
item.description: In this quick article, we learn how to change the servlet context path in the Spring Boot application.

item.title: Use Spring Boot Project as a Dependency
item.description: In this article, we will learn how to build a Spring Boot JAR as a library and use it as a dependency in other applications.

item.title: Configure embedded Undertow server in Spring Boot
item.description: In this quick tutorial, we’ll configure embedded Undertow server by replacing it with default Tomcat server in Spring Boot web application.

item.title: Conditional Annotations in Spring Boot
item.description: In this tutorial, we’ll take a look at Conditional Annotations in Spring Boot with examples.

item.title: application.properties vs application.yml in Spring Boot
item.description: In this tutorial, we’ll compare Spring Boot Configuration using YAML file and Property file and their advantages one over the other.

item.title: Spring @ConfigurationProperties using YAML
item.description: In this article, we’ll learn how to use @ConfigurationProperties with .yml file instead of .properties file for configuration in Spring Boot Project.

item.title: Spring Initializr Plugin for Eclipse IDE
item.description: In this article, we’ll learn how to install Spring Tool Plugin for Eclipse IDE to create a Spring Boot Project from Scratch using Spring Initializr.

item.title: Spring @Value Annotation Guide
item.description: In this article, we’ll learn how to inject values for Primitives, List, Map, and Date with inline values and from property file using @Value Annotation with examples. We’ll also see its usage with Constructor-based & Setter-based Injection, and SpEL.

item.title: Setup a Spring Boot Project using Spring Initializr
item.description: In this article, we’ll learn how to create a Spring Boot project quickly from scratch use Spring Initializer.

item.title: Configure embedded Jetty server in Spring Boot
item.description: In this quick tutorial, we’ll configure embedded Jetty server by replacing it with default Tomcat server in Spring Boot web application.

item.title: How to create and configure custom banner in spring boot
item.description:
Spring boot application comes with default banner which shows up first when you start your application.

 . ____ _ __ _ _
/\\ / ___'_ __ _ _(_)_ __ __ _ \ \ \ \
( ( )\___ | '_ | '_| | '_ \/ _` | \ \ \ \
\\/ ___)| |_)| | | | | || (_| | ) ) ) )
' |____| .__|_| |_|_| |_\__, | / / / /
=========|_|==============|___/=/_/_/_/
:: Spring Boot :: (v2.1.3.RELEASE)

You can replace above banner with your self made custom banner in following two easy steps:-

item.title: How to disable command line properties in spring boot
item.description:
Spring Boot Application converts any command line arguments starting with --, such as --spring.profiles.active=dev to a property by default and adds them to the Spring Environment. Command line properties always take precedence over other property sources.

If you do not want command line properties to be added to the Environment, you can disable them from SpringBootApplication main method as follows:-

item.title: How to change server port in spring boot
item.description:
Spring boot web application using embedded server by default runs on port 8080. Following are the ways to change default server port from 8080 to say 9090

Follow any of the given five ways to change server port:-

item.title: How to disable default banner in spring boot
item.description:
You would have seen below spring boot banner when starting a spring boot application

 . ____ _ __ _ _
/\\ / ___'_ __ _ _(_)_ __ __ _ \ \ \ \
( ( )\___ | '_ | '_| | '_ \/ _` | \ \ \ \
\\/ ___)| |_)| | | | | || (_| | ) ) ) )
' |____| .__|_| |_|_| |_\__, | / / / /
=========|_|==============|___/=/_/_/_/
:: Spring Boot :: (v2.1.3.RELEASE)

There are multiple ways to disable spring boot banner as follows:
